In children with established status epilepticus, i.e. seizures persisting after the first-line agent (benzodiazepine-resistant status epilepticus), which antiseizure medicines are associated with better clinical outcomes (stopping seizures and with less adverse effects)? Recommendation (update): In children with established status epilepticus, i.e. seizures persisting after two doses of benzodiazepines, intravenous fosphenytoin, intravenous phenytoin, intravenous levetiracetam, intravenous phenobarbital or intravenous valproic acid (sodium valproate) should be considered with appropriate monitoring. The choice of these medicines depends on local resources, including availability and facilities for monitoring.
